engineering_design_principles.description: Conversion and storage of solar energy in a usable form
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The use of a primary energy source, such as plants, to convert and store solar energy in a usable form, such as chemical energy, which can then be consumed and utilized by other organisms.

engineering_design_principles.description: Optimization of energy conversion and storage
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The application of mathematical calculations and geometric arrangements, such as the conversion of light energy into chemical energy, to optimize the efficiency of energy conversion and storage.
The design of complex structures, such as those found in plant cells, that contain pigments and enable the absorption of light energy from the sun.
